top_categories.workout_context: Bear 100 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 100 miles, Bear 100 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Bear 100. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Bear 100 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Bear 100’s gravel roads, northwoods terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Every session at Bear 100 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 100 miles, Bear 100 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Racing Bear 100 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Bear 100 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Bear 100. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on northwoods gravel roads.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Bear 100’s northwoods gravel roads delivers on race day.
The varied gradients at Bear 100 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Bear 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Bear 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on northwoods gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, northwoods terrain, forest roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Durability, and G Spot to prepare you for 100 miles of northwoods gravel roads in Laona, Wisconsin.
